author: Special Correspondent
text:
The job mela organised by the District Employment Office at Erode Arts and Science College on Saturday was patronised well by the student community. —PHOTO: M. GOVARTHAN

Over 800 youth received offers at the job mela conducted by the District Employment Office at Erode Arts and Science College on Saturday

District Collector S. Prabakar handed over the offer letters to the candidates and advised the student community to enrol themselves with the study circle in the District Employment Office to make themselves employable.

The host institution had conducted a coaching programme for the preceding fortnight to enable its students to maximise benefit from the camp, College Correspondent K.K. Balusamy said.

As many as 2,700 candidates with qualifications ranging from a pass in level V to post graduation turned up for the camp, and were offered jobs with salaries ranging from Rs. 7,000 to Rs. 35,000. More than 160 organisations in IT, consumer durables, insurance and other service sectors recruited the candidates.

The District Employment Office has been conducting such camps on a periodic basis to expand scope for employment for educated youth in private organisations. There were 2.12 lakh candidates in Erode with qualifications up to under graduation registered with the District Employment Office. Of them, 1.07 lakh candidates were women, District Employment Officer V. Vasudevan said.

Mahalir Thittam Project Officer T. Palanikumar and College Principal R. Venkatachalam also took part.
title: Job mela: over 800 receive offer letters in Erode
